page.title: 20Local History - Manor House
page.content: THIS IS SOMETIMES CALLED WOODHOUSE CASTLE.IT WAS BUILT IN THE 16TH CENTURY,IN GEORGIAN TIMES A PORCH AND MACHICOLATIONS WERE ADDED.IT WAS BUILT BY SIR.JOHN DIGBY'S GRANDFATHER, NOTTINGHAMSHIRE'S HIGH SHERRIFF,FAMOUS FOR HIS PART IN THE CIVIL WAR.HE FOUGHT AT THE BATTLE OF EDGEHILL IN 1642 ON THE KING'S SIDE TO CAPTURE NEWARK.WHEN SIR JOHN DIED THE HOUSE WAS PASSED ON TO HIS SON WHO DIED IN 1722,TO HIS GRANDSON WHO DIED IN 1728, THEN HIS SISTERS SOLD THE HOUSE TO JOHN HALL IN 1736.IN 1811 COLONEL NEED BOUGHT THE HOUSE AND ADDED ANOTHER PORCH.WHEN COLONEL NEED DIED HIS WIDOW AND SON LIVED HERE.WHEN HIS WIFE DIED SHERWOOD COLLIERY COMPANY BOUGHT THE HOUSE AND MANAGER JOHN TAYLOR LIVED HERE,WHEN HE DIED,MANSFIELD WOODHOUSE URBAN DISTRICT COUNCIL BOUGHT THE MANOR HOUSE IN 1933 FOR Â£1,500.
